comment._content: James Shanks in 1901: Justice of Peace for County of Dublin Managing Director Shanks and Co Ltd Mineral Worker Makers Dublin and Grand International Hotel Ltd. Bray

comment.author: 29809546@N00
comment._content:
Among the Smith-Barry tenants evicted from James Street on Tuesday 17th December 1889 (according to Freeman's the following day)
Patrick Cleary, draper Michael Kennedy, provision store James Davis, stationer Danl(sic) Ryan, victualler Jas Murray, boot manufacturer Michael Cross, draper Widow Bennett, harness maker
We know that Michael Cross and Patrick Cleary ended up in New Tipperary. I wonder about the others.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: There's a Boot man in the arcade, nearest shop on the right hand side of the other shot, I can't read the poster in the window, though. Royal Boots? Boland Boots?
